instructions.preparation: Sit and grasp dumbbell with underhand grip. Rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
instructions.execution: Allow dumbbell to roll out of palm down to fingers. Raise dumbbell back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

muscles.target: Flexor Carpi Ulnaris Extensor Carpi Ulnaris

exercises.name: Dumbbell Ulnar Deviation
exercises.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used.

instructions.preparation: Grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on pinkie side. Position arm down to side.
instructions.execution: Bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. Lower until weighted side is pointing downward. Repeat.

muscles.target: Extensor Carpi Radialis Flexor Carpi Radialis

exercises.name: Dumbbell Radial Deviation
exercises.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used.

instructions.preparation: Grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on thumb side. Position arm down to side.
instructions.execution: Bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. Lower until weighted side is pointing downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Reverse Wrist Curl
exercises.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

instructions.preparation: Sit and grip dumbbell with overhand grip. Rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
instructions.execution: Raise dummbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation (arm up)
exercises.comments: Pad or firm pillow (ball pictured) may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during initial range of motion. This exercise can also be performed seated by corner of table higher than shoulder height (See Dumbbell Seated Pronation. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface. Also see Dumbbell Lying Pronation with arm down.

instructions.preparation: Lie on bench or mat. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place arm on hip or side of waist. Position thumb upward (supinated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation (arm down)
exercises.comments: Bench can be flat or slightly incline (0-30 degrees) so resistance occurs during initial range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface. Also see conventiontal Dumbbell Lying Pronation.

instructions.preparation: Grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell with thumb next to weighted side. Lie on bench on side with weight and position arm with "half dumbbell" on bench. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and tucked bent elbow under body. Position thumb down (supinated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (pronation). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Pronation
exercises.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface.

instructions.preparation: Sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. Position thumb upward (supinated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Supination
exercises.comments: Pad or firm pillow may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface. Also see Dumbbell Lying Supination with arm down. This exercise can also be performed seated by corner of table higher than shoulder height (See Seated Supination).

instructions.preparation: Lie on bench or mat. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place forearm on hip, or side of waist. Position thumb downward (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Supination (arm down)
exercises.comments: Bench can be flat or slightly incline (0-30 degrees) so resistance occurs during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface. Also see conventional Dumbbell Lying Supination.

instructions.preparation: Grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell with pinkie finger next to weight side. Lie on bench on side with weight and position arm with "half dumbbell" on bench. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and tuck bent elbow under body. Position thumb up (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (supinated). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Supination
exercises.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface.

instructions.preparation: Sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. With hand of arm next to elevated surface, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. Position thumb downward (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Curl
exercises.comments: Biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl.

instructions.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

instructions.execution: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

instructions.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Reverse Preacher Curl
exercises.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad.

instructions.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Standing Reverse Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: Place back of arms on pad with one foot forward. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
instructions.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat.

instructions.execution: Raise barbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.

instructions.preparation: Position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
instructions.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell until forearm is vertical and thumb faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with alternative arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
exercises.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

instructions.preparation: Sit and grasp dumbbell with underhand grip. Rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
instructions.execution: Allow dumbbell to roll out of palm down to fingers. Raise dumbbell back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

exercises.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

instructions.preparation: Sit and grip dumbbell with overhand grip. Rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
instructions.execution: Raise dummbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation (arm up)
exercises.comments: Pad or firm pillow (ball pictured) may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during initial range of motion. This exercise can also be performed seated by corner of table higher than shoulder height (See Dumbbell Seated Pronation. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface. Also see Dumbbell Lying Pronation with arm down.

instructions.preparation: Lie on bench or mat. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place arm on hip or side of waist. Position thumb upward (supinated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation (arm down)
exercises.comments: Bench can be flat or slightly incline (0-30 degrees) so resistance occurs during initial range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface. Also see conventiontal Dumbbell Lying Pronation.

instructions.preparation: Grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell with thumb next to weighted side. Lie on bench on side with weight and position arm with "half dumbbell" on bench. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and tucked bent elbow under body. Position thumb down (supinated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (pronation). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Pronation
exercises.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface.

instructions.preparation: Sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. Position thumb upward (supinated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Supination
exercises.comments: Pad or firm pillow may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface. Also see Dumbbell Lying Supination with arm down. This exercise can also be performed seated by corner of table higher than shoulder height (See Seated Supination).

instructions.preparation: Lie on bench or mat. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place forearm on hip, or side of waist. Position thumb downward (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Supination (arm down)
exercises.comments: Bench can be flat or slightly incline (0-30 degrees) so resistance occurs during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface. Also see conventional Dumbbell Lying Supination.

instructions.preparation: Grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell with pinkie finger next to weight side. Lie on bench on side with weight and position arm with "half dumbbell" on bench. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and tuck bent elbow under body. Position thumb up (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (supinated). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Supination
exercises.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface.

instructions.preparation: Sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. With hand of arm next to elevated surface, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. Position thumb downward (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Curl
exercises.comments: Biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl.

instructions.preparation: Position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
instructions.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Curl
exercises.comments: This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl.

instructions.preparation: Sit back on 45-60 degree incline bench. With arms hanging down straight, position two dumbbells with palms facing inward.
instructions.execution: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

exercises.name: Barbell Reverse Curl
exercises.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

instructions.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Reverse Preacher Curl
exercises.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad.

instructions.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Standing Reverse Preacher Curl
exercises.comments: Body should be positioned to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad.

instructions.preparation: Place back of arms on pad with one foot forward. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
instructions.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Wrist Curl
exercises.comments: Keep elbows approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion.

instructions.preparation: Sit and grasp bar with narrow to shoulder width underhand grip. Rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
instructions.execution: Allow barbell to roll out of palms down to fingers. Raise barbell back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl
exercises.comments: Keep elbows approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion.

instructions.preparation: Sit and grasp bar with narrow to shoulder width overhand grip. Rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
instructions.execution: Raise barbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
exercises.comments: The biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

instructions.preparation: Position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
instructions.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell until forearm is vertical and thumb faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with alternative arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
exercises.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

instructions.preparation: Sit and grasp dumbbell with underhand grip. Rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
instructions.execution: Allow dumbbell to roll out of palm down to fingers. Raise dumbbell back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

muscles.target: Flexor Carpi Ulnaris Extensor Carpi Ulnaris

exercises.name: Dumbbell Ulnar Deviation
exercises.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used.

instructions.preparation: Grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on pinkie side. Position arm down to side.
instructions.execution: Bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. Lower until weighted side is pointing downward. Repeat.

muscles.target: Extensor Carpi Radialis Flexor Carpi Radialis

exercises.name: Dumbbell Radial Deviation
exercises.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used.

instructions.preparation: Grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on thumb side. Position arm down to side.
instructions.execution: Bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. Lower until weighted side is pointing downward. Repeat.

instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (pronation). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Pronation
exercises.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface.

instructions.preparation: Sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. Position thumb upward (supinated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Supination
exercises.comments: Pad or firm pillow may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface. Also see Dumbbell Lying Supination with arm down. This exercise can also be performed seated by corner of table higher than shoulder height (See Seated Supination).

instructions.preparation: Lie on bench or mat. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place forearm on hip, or side of waist. Position thumb downward (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Supination (arm down)
exercises.comments: Bench can be flat or slightly incline (0-30 degrees) so resistance occurs during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface. Also see conventional Dumbbell Lying Supination.

instructions.preparation: Grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell with pinkie finger next to weight side. Lie on bench on side with weight and position arm with "half dumbbell" on bench. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and tuck bent elbow under body. Position thumb up (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (supinated). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Supination
exercises.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface.

instructions.preparation: Sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. With hand of arm next to elevated surface, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. Position thumb downward (pronated).
instructions.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Curl
exercises.comments: Biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl.

instructions.preparation: Position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
instructions.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Curl
exercises.comments: This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl.

instructions.preparation: Sit back on 45-60 degree incline bench. With arms hanging down straight, position two dumbbells with palms facing inward.
instructions.execution: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

exercises.name: Barbell Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension. A wide overhand grip involves overall back musculature while slightly emphasizing Rear Delt, Infraspinatus and Teres Minor involvement.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to upper waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Close Grip Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Underhand Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with underhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Pullover
exercises.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Bent Arm Pullover.

instructions.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent slightly.
instructions.execution: With elbows bent slightly, lower bar over and beyond head until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Bent Arm Pullover
exercises.comments: Keep elbows bent approximately 90° throughout exercise. Keep hips from raising up significantly. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Pullover.

instructions.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent approximately 90°.
instructions.execution: With elbow bent, lower bar over and just behind head until upper arm is approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Shrug
exercises.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: Stand holding barbell with overhand or mixed grip; shoulder width or slightly wider.
instructions.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Torso should be close to horizontal. Positioning supporting knee and/or arm slightly forward or back will allow for proper levelling of torso. Torso may be positioned lower to allow for heavier dumbbell to make contact with floor, if desired.

instructions.preparation: Kneel over side of bench by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side. Grasp dumbbell from floor.
instructions.execution: Pull dumbbell to up to side until it makes contact with ribs or until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Row
exercises.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor.

instructions.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
instructions.execution: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond horizontal or height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shrug
exercises.comments: Exercise may be performed standing perfectly upright or very slightly bent over. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: Stand holding dumbbells to sides.
instructions.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Placing towel roll under arm increase infraspinatus and teres minor EMG signal 20% to 25% compared to no towel roll (Reinold MM, et al. 2004). Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.

instructions.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: Lift dumbbell by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip over and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Position incline as low as possible so dumbbell can still be aligned against gravity.

instructions.preparation: Lie high up on low incline bench or reverse on decline bench on side with arm pit over leg pad (as demonstrated). Position legs lower on bench for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: Lift dumbbell upright above elbow by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip body over and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) in front of body, chest or shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Sit on bench. Place foot on other side of bench and other foot on floor with knees bent. Place upper elbow on knee with dumbbell positioned above knee.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell downward toward lower leg by rotating shoulder until slight stretch is felt. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Stand or sit with dumbbell positioned out to side of head; bend elbow, shoulder height with dumbbell above elbow.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation (with support)
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Stand or sit with side against chest height platform. With dumbbell in hand, position upper arm horizontally on platform, elbow bent so forearm is upright.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on bench)
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow's bend and position at edge of bench against side of body throughout exercise. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on bench close to edge on side with dumbbell in hand. Position elbow on edge of bench against side of body with elbow bent approximately 90°. Position legs on bench for support.
instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on floor)
exercises.comments: Torso can lean back slightly allowing for fuller range of motion at the bottom of movement. In which case, forearm does not need to travel any closer than vertical toward body. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on mat with dumbbell in hand. Position upper arm on mat close to body. Bend elbow approximately 90° with dumbbell held upright above elbow.
instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell toward floor until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is vertical and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell toward floor until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is vertical and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation (with support)
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Stand or sit with side against chest height platform. With dumbbell in hand, position upper arm horizontally on platform, elbow bent so forearm is upright.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on bench)
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow's bend and position at edge of bench against side of body throughout exercise. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on bench close to edge on side with dumbbell in hand. Position elbow on edge of bench against side of body with elbow bent approximately 90°. Position legs on bench for support.
instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on floor)
exercises.comments: Torso can lean back slightly allowing for fuller range of motion at the bottom of movement. In which case, forearm does not need to travel any closer than vertical toward body. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on mat with dumbbell in hand. Position upper arm on mat close to body. Bend elbow approximately 90° with dumbbell held upright above elbow.
instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell toward floor until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is vertical and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Barbell Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension. A wide overhand grip involves overall back musculature while slightly emphasizing Rear Delt, Infraspinatus and Teres Minor involvement.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to upper waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Close Grip Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Underhand Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with underhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Pullover
exercises.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Bent Arm Pullover.

instructions.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent slightly.
instructions.execution: With elbows bent slightly, lower bar over and beyond head until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Bent Arm Pullover
exercises.comments: Keep elbows bent approximately 90° throughout exercise. Keep hips from raising up significantly. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Pullover.

instructions.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent approximately 90°.
instructions.execution: With elbow bent, lower bar over and just behind head until upper arm is approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Shrug
exercises.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: Stand holding barbell with overhand or mixed grip; shoulder width or slightly wider.
instructions.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Torso should be close to horizontal. Positioning supporting knee and/or arm slightly forward or back will allow for proper levelling of torso. Torso may be positioned lower to allow for heavier dumbbell to make contact with floor, if desired.

instructions.preparation: Kneel over side of bench by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side. Grasp dumbbell from floor.
instructions.execution: Pull dumbbell to up to side until it makes contact with ribs or until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Row
exercises.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor.

instructions.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
instructions.execution: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond horizontal or height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shrug
exercises.comments: Exercise may be performed standing perfectly upright or very slightly bent over. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: Stand holding dumbbells to sides.
instructions.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Placing towel roll under arm increase infraspinatus and teres minor EMG signal 20% to 25% compared to no towel roll (Reinold MM, et al. 2004). Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.

instructions.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: Lift dumbbell by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip over and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Position incline as low as possible so dumbbell can still be aligned against gravity.

instructions.preparation: Lie high up on low incline bench or reverse on decline bench on side with arm pit over leg pad (as demonstrated). Position legs lower on bench for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: Lift dumbbell upright above elbow by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip body over and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) in front of body, chest or shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Sit on bench. Place foot on other side of bench and other foot on floor with knees bent. Place upper elbow on knee with dumbbell positioned above knee.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell downward toward lower leg by rotating shoulder until slight stretch is felt. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Stand or sit with dumbbell positioned out to side of head; bend elbow, shoulder height with dumbbell above elbow.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation (with support)
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Stand or sit with side against chest height platform. With dumbbell in hand, position upper arm horizontally on platform, elbow bent so forearm is upright.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on bench)
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow's bend and position at edge of bench against side of body throughout exercise. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on bench close to edge on side with dumbbell in hand. Position elbow on edge of bench against side of body with elbow bent approximately 90°. Position legs on bench for support.
instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Underhand Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with underhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Pullover
exercises.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Bent Arm Pullover.

instructions.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent slightly.
instructions.execution: With elbows bent slightly, lower bar over and beyond head until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Bent Arm Pullover
exercises.comments: Keep elbows bent approximately 90° throughout exercise. Keep hips from raising up significantly. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Pullover.

instructions.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent approximately 90°.
instructions.execution: With elbow bent, lower bar over and just behind head until upper arm is approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Shrug
exercises.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: Stand holding barbell with overhand or mixed grip; shoulder width or slightly wider.
instructions.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Torso should be close to horizontal. Positioning supporting knee and/or arm slightly forward or back will allow for proper levelling of torso. Torso may be positioned lower to allow for heavier dumbbell to make contact with floor, if desired.

instructions.preparation: Kneel over side of bench by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side. Grasp dumbbell from floor.
instructions.execution: Pull dumbbell to up to side until it makes contact with ribs or until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Row
exercises.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor.

instructions.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
instructions.execution: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond horizontal or height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shrug
exercises.comments: Exercise may be performed standing perfectly upright or very slightly bent over. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

instructions.preparation: Stand holding dumbbells to sides.
instructions.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lying Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Placing towel roll under arm increase infraspinatus and teres minor EMG signal 20% to 25% compared to no towel roll (Reinold MM, et al. 2004). Also see Dumbbell Shoulder External Rotation Errors.

instructions.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: Lift dumbbell by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip over and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Position incline as low as possible so dumbbell can still be aligned against gravity.

instructions.preparation: Lie high up on low incline bench or reverse on decline bench on side with arm pit over leg pad (as demonstrated). Position legs lower on bench for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
instructions.execution: Lift dumbbell upright above elbow by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip body over and continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Seated Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) in front of body, chest or shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Sit on bench. Place foot on other side of bench and other foot on floor with knees bent. Place upper elbow on knee with dumbbell positioned above knee.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell downward toward lower leg by rotating shoulder until slight stretch is felt. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Stand or sit with dumbbell positioned out to side of head; bend elbow, shoulder height with dumbbell above elbow.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation (with support)
exercises.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

instructions.preparation: Stand or sit with side against chest height platform. With dumbbell in hand, position upper arm horizontally on platform, elbow bent so forearm is upright.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on bench)
exercises.comments: Maintain elbow's bend and position at edge of bench against side of body throughout exercise. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on bench close to edge on side with dumbbell in hand. Position elbow on edge of bench against side of body with elbow bent approximately 90°. Position legs on bench for support.
instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on floor)
exercises.comments: Torso can lean back slightly allowing for fuller range of motion at the bottom of movement. In which case, forearm does not need to travel any closer than vertical toward body. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

instructions.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on mat with dumbbell in hand. Position upper arm on mat close to body. Bend elbow approximately 90° with dumbbell held upright above elbow.
instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell toward floor until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is vertical and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Barbell Bent-over Row
exercises.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension. A wide overhand grip involves overall back musculature while slightly emphasizing Rear Delt, Infraspinatus and Teres Minor involvement.

instructions.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Pull bar to upper waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.

instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

instructions.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Continue with opposite arm.

instructions.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on mat with dumbbell in hand. Position upper arm on mat close to body. Bend elbow approximately 90° with dumbbell held upright above elbow.
instructions.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell toward floor until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is vertical and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Powerlifting Bench Press.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to mid-chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press (power lift)
exercises.comments: Competitive lifting requires bar to make contact with chest above bottom of the sternum with momentary pause. Gluteus Maximus, Erector Spinae, Quadriceps, and other muscles may be considered significant stabilizers during actual powerlift. Also see Standard-style Bench Press and Bench Press Strength Standards.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Grasp bar with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Arch back, extend hips, and position feet back flat on floor. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to lower chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Guillotine Bench Press
exercises.comments: Upper arm travels in perpendicular path to torso to minimize anterior deltoid involvement.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to neck. Upper arms will be perpendicular to torso. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press (with chains)
exercises.comments: Chains provide increasing resistance as barbell moves away from floor. Chains can be used during either Powerlift-style Bench Press or Standard-style Bench Press.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Grasp barbell loaded with thick chains from each side, with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Decline Bench Press
exercises.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on decline bench with feet under leg brace. Dismount barbell from rack over chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to upper chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Incline Bench Press
exercises.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to upper chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Incline Shoulder Raise
exercises.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on Barbell Incline Chest Press.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench. Dismount barbell from rack with shoulder width overhand grip. Position barbell over upper chest with elbows extended.
instructions.execution: Raise shoulders toward bar as high as possible. Lower shoulders to bench and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
exercises.comments: Dumbbells should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights - see suggested mount and dismount techniques: standard or advanced. Also see mount & dismount from special machine rack.

instructions.preparation: Sit down on bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick weights to shoulder and lie back. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.
instructions.execution: Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of upper chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
exercises.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights - see suggested mount and dismount technique. Also see mount & dismount from special machine rack.

instructions.preparation: Sit down on decline bench with feet under leg brace and dumbbells resting on thigh. Lie back with dumbbells. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.
instructions.execution: Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Decline Fly
exercises.comments: None

instructions.preparation: Grasp two dumbbells. Lie supine on decline bench. Support dumbbells above upper abdomen with arms fixed in slightly bent position. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are to sides.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbells to sides until chest muscles are stretched with elbows fixed. Bring dumbbells together in hugging motion until dumbbells are nearly together. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Fly
exercises.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position.

instructions.preparation: Grasp two dumbbells. Lie supine on bench. Support dumbbells above chest with arms fixed in slightly bent position. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbells to sides until chest muscles are stretched with elbows fixed in slightly bent position. Bring dumbbells together in hugging motion until dumbbells are nearly together. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover
exercises.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount & dismount.

instructions.preparation: Lie on upper back perpendicular to bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp one dumbbell from behind or from side with both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Position dumbbell over chest with elbows slightly bent.
instructions.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover (on apparatus)
exercises.comments: Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount & dismount.

instructions.preparation: Sit on lower pad with back against upper pad, facing dumbbell in rack. Position feet under padded bars. Grasp dumbbell by handle with both hands. Pull top of dumbbell to chest. Push dumbbell up over chest with both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Raise hips up from pad and recline torso back so chest faces upward. Keep hips and elbows slightly bent.
instructions.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover (on arched bench)
exercises.comments: Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount & dismount.

instructions.preparation: Sit on seat of arched bench with dumbbell on lower thigh. Kick dumbbell up to shoulder while lying back on bench. Grasp both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Position dumbbell over chest with elbows slightly bent.
instructions.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
exercises.comments: Dumbbell should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. See suggested mount & dismount and mount & dismount from special machine rack. Also see elevated foot leg positioning to decrease arch in back.

instructions.preparation: Sit down on incline bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick weights to shoulders and lean back. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with upper arm under each dumbbell.
instructions.execution: Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of upper chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Fly
exercises.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Shoulder will likely have less range of motion in lower position as compared to Fly on flat bench.

instructions.preparation: Grasp two dumbbells. Lie supine on bench. Support dumbbells above upper chest with arms fixed in slightly bent position. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
instructions.execution: Lower dumbbells outward to sides of shoulders. Keep elbows fixed in slightly bent position. When a stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, bring dumbbells back together in hugging motion above upper chest until dumbbells are nearly together. Repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder Raise
exercises.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on Dumbbell Incline Chest Press.

instructions.preparation: Sit down on incline bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick weights to shoulders and lean back. Position dumbbells above shoulders with elbows extended.
instructions.execution: Raise shoulders toward dumbbells as high as possible. Lower shoulders to bench and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Powerlifting Bench Press.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to mid-chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press (power lift)
exercises.comments: Competitive lifting requires bar to make contact with chest above bottom of the sternum with momentary pause. Gluteus Maximus, Erector Spinae, Quadriceps, and other muscles may be considered significant stabilizers during actual powerlift. Also see Standard-style Bench Press and Bench Press Strength Standards.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Grasp bar with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Arch back, extend hips, and position feet back flat on floor. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to lower chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Guillotine Bench Press
exercises.comments: Upper arm travels in perpendicular path to torso to minimize anterior deltoid involvement.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to neck. Upper arms will be perpendicular to torso. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press (with chains)
exercises.comments: Chains provide increasing resistance as barbell moves away from floor. Chains can be used during either Powerlift-style Bench Press or Standard-style Bench Press.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Grasp barbell loaded with thick chains from each side, with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Decline Bench Press
exercises.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on decline bench with feet under leg brace. Dismount barbell from rack over chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to upper chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Incline Bench Press
exercises.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
instructions.execution: Lower weight to upper chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Incline Shoulder Raise
exercises.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on Barbell Incline Chest Press.

instructions.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench. Dismount barbell from rack with shoulder width overhand grip. Position barbell over upper chest with elbows extended.
instructions.execution: Raise shoulders toward bar as high as possible. Lower shoulders to bench and repeat.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
